comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Likely the Rev Homer R. Salisbury, a missionary, who was lost on the P&O liner Persia in January 1916. According to Philadelphia Evening Public Ledger., January 06, 1916, Night Extra, Page 4, Col 1 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83045211/1916-01-06/ed-... ""The Rev. Homer R, Salisbury, native born American citizen, sailed from Marseilles, France, on Persia. He formerly lived In Tacoma Park. D. C. Steamship captain confirms his sailing and believes him lost" en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SS_Persia_(1900) indicates that the Persia, under the British flag, was sunk by a submarine

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: A photo in The Ogden standard., January 14, 1916, 4 P.M. CITY EDITION, Image 1 approves that it's this man.
